data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions are from the beginning point. It makes no sense to make directions that go backwards. So, the answer is no.

Turning right after coming back around does not allow you to return to turning left. So, the answer is no.

You can return to the starting point by taking 12 steps from the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

To take one step, you should take 1 step. From there, you're back to the start point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you walk with your feet together and look forward, you will always be facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps to get to the starting point. Take 9 steps to get to the starting point. Take 2 steps to move to the starting point. Take 7 steps to get to the starting point. Take 3 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

People usually take one step backward and go forward. The first step forward you take is the one you always face forward. So, the answer is no.

So, the answer is No.
